question_text:
Question 38
 
 
Which one of the following CIDR prefixes exactly represents the range of IP addresses 10.12.2.0 to 
10.12.3.255 ?                                  
[Computer Network, 1 Concept of Layering and LAN Technologies] 
 
(A) 10.12.2.0/23 
(B) 10.12.2.0/24 
 
(C) 10.12.0.0/22 
(D) 10.12.2.0/22 
Ans. 
(A)
explanation_text:
Sol.
 
We know that IP address are contiguous, block size is power of 2, and starting address is divisible by 
block size so, they can form a block.
10.12.2.0 to 10.12.2.255 = 256
10.12.3.0 to 10.12.3.255 = 256
Total IP address   [10.12.2.0 to 10.12.3.255]
9
256
256
512
2




Number of bit for Host id = 9 bit

PAGE
25

Number of bit for Net id (NiD) = 32 – 9 = 23 bit
CIDR notation represented as
10.12.2.0/23
Hence, the correct option is (A)
